reviews.headline: Saves my skin from hard water!!
reviews.comments: I live in an area with the hardest water that dries my skin out badly. For years, I've sprayed this water on my face, hands, and arms and then massage in my face and body lotion. I'm hydrated all dang day, with no dryness at all! It's liquid gold!

reviews.headline: It might be magic...
reviews.comments: This spray is a game changer for me. It probably has magic in it because it works so well. I have incredibly sensitive skin that gets really reactive due to rosacea. But a short mist with this water and my skin calms right down. I keep a travel size in my work bag and a big size at home.

After a few days my skin is practically back to normal and even feels softer than usual. It's definitely not just water.

reviews.headline: Amazing
reviews.comments: This spray is my absolute holy grail. I have combination, sensitive, acne-prone skin and this calms my skin soooo well. I notice a visible change in my skin when I don't use this spray. For application, I usually spray this right after washing my face while my skin is damp and let it sit for a couple minutes before patting my skin dry. Kinda like a toner. This is a vital product in my everyday/night skincare routine and I will forever repurchase.

faceoff_positive.comments: It makes my skin look absolutely flawless! I have generally very sensitive/ oily skin with the occasional breakouts and is also dry and over-cracked lips. When I use the Avene Thermal Spring water spray, my skin clears up and pours nearly disappear. The texture softens and the redness I have goes away. My lips are also baby soft... I can't explain the magic behind it, just that it exists. The results are noticeable within days! I highly recommend this product.
faceoff_positive.headline: Makes Skin Glowing and Flawless!

faceoff_negative.comments: This spray can be refreshing AFTER I've rinsed off face cleanser with tap water. But using it to help remove the cleanser with tissues is NO GOOD for me. My skin is very sensitive to friction. Accordingly, wiping my face--for ANY reason--even with this spay and the strongest, softest tissue I can find leaves my face red and irritated. And my skin feels unwashed.    But since I bought it, I didn't want to waste it. So I use it to dampen my hair on post-wash days 1 and often day 2. But that's a very expensive way to dampen hair when a spray bottle of tap water works just as well.    Bottom line: FOR ME, this is purely a luxury item. My skin, though extremely sensitive, can tolerate my municipal tap water. For a person on my budget, tolerant of tap water, purchasing a pricey can of water is nothing less than ridiculous.
faceoff_negative.headline: Purely a ridiculous luxury item (for ME)
